name: Free of Charge
description:
Inspired by the present and future of how we move as a society, alongside the natural cooperative effort of games like It Takes Two, we embarked on a journey to make a game for a young audience (9 to 12 years old) where we put them in the shoes of a two-player team who are in control of an electric scooter and a mission to communicate and deliver the right colored and shaped battery to keep the energy in society renewable and safe but starting from the smallest of sizes in order to make the biggest of differences.

As a team, this project led to plenty of challenges since the basic ideas evolved into something greater; which doubled our challenges considering the limited time. Nevertheless, we plowed forward and worked intensely in order to deliver our best vision of the game. By the end, we were appreciative of everyone's efforts and were glad we reached a point we felt we had a game that felt fun and made people communicate, try again, and laugh.

Team 12:

Designers
Jonathan Berkán
Marcos Correa
Simon Håkansson
Ella Lopez

Artists
Emil Brax
Xander Jemide
Ka Sonn Tang

Programmers
Einar Hallik
William Strand Paurell
